thread.title: David Beckham, Brooklyn Beckham and Ed Sheeran walk out of London pub after taunts from football hooligans
thread.title_full: David Beckham, Brooklyn Beckham and Ed Sheeran walk out of London pub after taunts from football hooligans

author: Hayley Minn
title: David Beckham, Brooklyn Beckham and Ed Sheeran walk out of London pub after taunts from football hooligans
text:
David Beckham, Brooklyn Beckham and Ed Sheeran walk out of London pub after taunts from football hooligans Wales fans chanted at the former England captain and his son Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
David Beckham , his son Brooklyn and Ed Sheeran were all forced to walk out of a North London pub on Thursday after taunts from football hooligans. 
The crowd had just watched a special screening of a documentary about Don’t Take Me Home - Wales’ 2016 European Championship campaign. 
And the Wales football fans were shouting national anthem Land Of My Fathers in the direction of David. 
The fans in the Shepherd’s Bush pub also tried to tell David about a video tweet sent by the English FA to their Welsh counterparts showing him scoring against them. Read More David Beckham was forced to walk out of a London pub (Photo: Getty) He was with his son Brooklyn Beckham (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
But he was unaware of the tweet and the Welsh FA’s response, which showed the current FIFA rankings, with England one place below Wales. 
A source told The Sun : “The boys were enjoying a catch up when suddenly the pub was taken over by Welsh fans at around 8.30pm. 
“They tried to remain discreet wearing beanies and caps but the supporters recognised them and sang Welsh anthems, buoyed by the fact the pub was decked in Welsh flags. 
“It started to get a bit annoying, forcing Becks to call it a night. And Ed Sheeran was also there (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
"He couldn’t be bothered with it.” 
Meanwhile, Brooklyn turns 18 tomorrow on 4 March, and, to mark his son’s birthday, David took to Instagram to share an embarrassing baby photo. 
In the old photo, baby Brooklyn sits in the bath with a fluffy white beard made out of bubbles. Read More Who would be in a Michael Carrick All-Star XI? We pick the team to face Man United star in his testimonial (Photo: davidbeckham/Instagram) 
And he promised this bath time snap won’t be the last photo he’ll post to make Brooklyn cringe. 
“This little man turns 18 tomorrow so as you can imagine I have many photos to post so here we go,” he commented on the photo shared with his 33.4m followers. 
“Happy 18th eve to my handsome young man and best friend.” Like us on Facebook
